data.title: Floating puzzle parts
data.statement:
Given a not finished puzzle find out how many floating puzzle parts are not placed yet.
The progress on your puzzle is given by a 2D board with <<1>>s and <<0>>s, where <<1>> indicates an already placed part and <<0>> indicates a free slot.
A floating puzzle part is the slot where you have to place a part but it hasn't got any neighboring parts place also. 

For example:
You're given the <<3>> by <<3>> puzzle with <<9>> parts:

100
100
111

It has <<5>> parts already placed and <<4>> to be placed, but only <<ONE>> of that 4 is a floating part, the top right corner, because there are no parts placed around it. So the answer her is <<1>>.
data.constraints:
0 < [[W]], [[H]] < 20
Neighbors for a part are considered in its 4 directions <<UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGTH>>
data.stubGenerator:
read w:int h:int
loop h read puzzleRow:string(w)
write floatingPartsCount
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Width [[W]] and height [[H]] of the puzzle
<< [[H]] Lines:>> Each line contains [[W]] characters representing a row of the puzzle.

Characters can be:
`{{1}} - Placed part
{{0}} - Empty slot`

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a not finished puzzle find out how many floating puzzle parts are not placed yet.
The progress on your puzzle is given by a 2D board with 1s and 0s, where 1 indicates an already placed part and 0 indicates a free slot.
A floating puzzle part is the slot where you have to place a part but it hasn't got any neighboring parts place also.

For example:
You're given the 3 by 3 puzzle with 9 parts:

100
100
111

It has 5 parts already placed and 4 to be placed, but only ONE of that 4 is a floating part, the top right corner, because there are no parts placed around it. So the answer her is 1.
Input
Line 1: Width W and height H of the puzzle
H Lines: Each line contains W characters representing a row of the puzzle.

Characters can be:
1 - Placed part
0 - Empty slot
Output
floatingPartsCount the count of the floating parts
Constraints
0 < W, H < 20
Neighbors for a part are considered in its 4 directions UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGTH
Example
Input
3 3
100
100
111
Output
1
